verses.verse: Now there cried<WH6817> a certain<WH259> woman<WH802> of the wives<WH802> of the sons<WH1121> of the prophets<WH5030> unto Elisha<WH477>, saying<WH559>, Thy servant<WH5650> my husband<WH376> is dead<WH4191>; and thou knowest<WH3045> that thy servant<WH5650> did fear<WH3373> Jehovah<WH3068>: and the creditor<WH5383> is come<WH935> to take<WH3947> unto him my two<WH8147> children<WH3206> to be bondmen<WH5650>.

And Elisha<WH477> said<WH559> unto her<WH6213>, What shall I do for thee<WH5046>? tell me<WH3426>; what hast thou in the house<WH1004>? And she said<WH559>, Thy handmaid<WH8198> hath not anything in the house<WH1004>, save a pot<WH610> of oil<WH8081>.
Then he said<WH559>, Go<WH3212>, borrow<WH7592> thee vessels<WH3627> abroad<WH2351> of all thy neighbors<WH7934>, even empty<WH7386> vessels<WH3627>; borrow not a few<WH4591>.

And thou shalt go in<WH935>, and shut<WH5462> the door<WH1817> upon thee and upon thy sons<WH1121>, and pour out<WH3332> into all those vessels<WH3627>; and thou shalt set aside<WH5265> that which is full<WH4392>.
So she went<WH3212> from him<WH5462>, and shut the door<WH1817> upon her and upon<WH1157> her sons<WH1121>; they<WH1992> brought<WH5066> the vessels to her<WH3332>, and she poured out.

And it came to pass<WH3627>, when the vessels were full<WH4390>, that she said<WH559> unto her son<WH1121>, Bring<WH5066> me yet a vessel<WH3627>. And he said<WH559> unto her<WH3627>, There is not a vessel more<WH8081>. And the oil stayed<WH5975>.

Then she came<WH935> and told<WH5046> the man<WH376> of God<WH430>. And he said<WH559>, Go<WH3212>, sell<WH4376> the oil<WH8081>, and pay<WH7999> thy debt<WH5386>, and live<WH2421> thou and thy sons<WH1121> of the rest<WH3498>.

And it fell on a day<WH3117>, that Elisha<WH477> passed<WH5674> to Shunem<WH7766>, where was a great<WH1419> woman<WH802>; and she constrained<WH2388> him to eat<WH398> bread<WH3899>. And so it was<WH1767>, that as oft as he passed by<WH5674>, he turned<WH5493> in thither to eat<WH398> bread<WH3899>.
And she said<WH559> unto her husband<WH376>, Behold now<WH3045>, I perceive that this is a holy<WH6918> man<WH376> of God<WH430>, that passeth<WH5674> by us continually<WH8548>.

Let us make<WH6213>, I pray thee<WH6996>, a little chamber<WH5944> on the wall<WH7023>; and let us set<WH7760> for him there a bed<WH4296>, and a table<WH7979>, and a seat<WH3678>, and a candlestick<WH4501>: and it shall be<WH935>, when he cometh to us<WH5493>, that he shall turn in thither.
And it fell on a day<WH3117>, that he came<WH935> thither<WH5493>, and he turned into the chamber<WH5944> and lay there<WH7901>.
And he said<WH559> to Gehazi<WH1522> his servant<WH5288>, Call<WH7121> this Shunammite<WH7767>. And when he had called<WH7121> her<WH5975>, she stood before him<WH6440>.

And he said<WH559> unto him<WH559>, Say now unto her<WH2729>, Behold, thou hast been careful for us with all this care<WH2731>; what is to be done<WH6213> for thee<WH3426>? wouldest thou be spoken<WH1696> for to the king<WH4428>, or to the captain<WH8269> of the host<WH6635>? And she answered<WH559>, I dwell<WH3427> among<WH8432> mine own people<WH5971>.
And he said<WH559>, What then is to be done<WH6213> for her<WH1522>? And Gehazi answered<WH559>, Verily<WH61> she hath no son<WH1121>, and her husband<WH376> is old<WH2204>.
And he said<WH559>, Call<WH7121> her<WH7121>. And when he had called her<WH5975>, she stood in the door<WH6607>.

And he said<WH559>, At this season<WH4150>, when the time<WH6256> cometh round<WH2416>, thou shalt embrace<WH2263> a son<WH1121>. And she said<WH559>, Nay<WH113>, my lord, thou man<WH376> of God<WH430>, do not lie<WH3576> unto thy handmaid<WH8198>.
And the woman<WH802> conceived<WH2029>, and bare<WH3205> a son<WH1121> at that season<WH4150>, when the time<WH6256> came round<WH2416>, as Elisha<WH477> had said unto her<WH1696>.
And when the child<WH3206> was grown<WH1431>, it fell on a day<WH3117>, that he went out<WH3318> to his father<WH1> to the reapers<WH7114>.
And he said<WH559> unto his father<WH1>, My head<WH7218>, my head<WH7218>. And he said<WH559> to his servant<WH5288>, Carry<WH5375> him to his mother<WH517>.
And when he had taken<WH5375> him<WH935>, and brought him to his mother<WH517>, he sat<WH3427> on her knees<WH1290> till noon<WH6672>, and then died<WH4191>.
And she went up<WH5927> and laid<WH7901> him on the bed<WH4296> of the man<WH376> of God<WH430>, and shut<WH5462> the door upon him<WH3318>, and went out.

And she called<WH7121> unto her husband<WH376>, and said<WH559>, Send<WH7971> me<WH259>, I pray thee, one of the servants<WH5288>, and one<WH259> of the asses<WH860>, that I may run<WH7323> to the man<WH376> of God<WH430>, and come again<WH7725>.
And he said<WH559>, Wherefore wilt thou go<WH1980> to him to-day<WH3117>? it is neither new moon<WH2320> nor sabbath<WH7676>. And she said<WH559>, It shall be well<WH7965>.
Then she saddled<WH2280> an ass<WH860>, and said<WH559> to her servant<WH5288>, Drive<WH5090>, and go forward<WH3212>; slacken<WH6113> me not the riding<WH7392>, except I bid thee<WH559>.

So she went<WH3212>, and came<WH935> unto the man<WH376> of God<WH430> to mount<WH2022> Carmel<WH3760>. And it came to pass<WH376>, when the man of God<WH430> saw her afar off<WH7200>, that he said<WH559> to Gehazi<WH1522> his servant<WH5288>, Behold<WH1975>, yonder is the Shunammite<WH7767>:

run <WH7323>, I pray thee<WH7125>, now to meet her<WH559>, and say unto her<WH7965>, Is it well with thee<WH7965>? is it well with thy husband<WH376>? is it well<WH7965> with the child<WH3206>? And she answered<WH559>, It is well<WH7965>.

And when she came<WH935> to the man<WH376> of God<WH430> to the hill<WH2022>, she caught<WH2388> hold of his feet<WH7272>. And Gehazi<WH1522> came near<WH5066> to thrust her away<WH1920>; but the man<WH376> of God<WH430> said<WH559>, Let her alone<WH7503>: for her soul<WH5315> is vexed<WH4843> within her<WH3068>; and Jehovah hath hid<WH5956> it from me<WH5046>, and hath not told me.
Then she said<WH559>, Did I desire<WH7592> a son<WH1121> of my lord<WH113>? did I not say<WH559>, Do not deceive me<WH7952>?

Then he said<WH559> to Gehazi<WH1522>, Gird up<WH2296> thy loins<WH4975>, and take<WH3947> my staff<WH4938> in thy hand<WH3027>, and go thy way<WH3212>: if thou meet<WH4672> any man<WH376>, salute<WH1288> him not<WH376>; and if any salute<WH1288> thee<WH6030>, answer him not again: and lay<WH7760> my staff<WH4938> upon the face<WH6440> of the child<WH5288>.

And the mother<WH517> of the child<WH5288> said<WH559>, As Jehovah<WH3068> liveth<WH2416>, and as thy soul<WH5315> liveth<WH2416>, I will not leave<WH5800> thee<WH6965>. And he arose, and followed her<WH3212>.

And Gehazi<WH1522> passed on<WH5674> before<WH6440> them<WH7760>, and laid the staff<WH4938> upon the face<WH6440> of the child<WH5288>; but there was neither voice<WH6963>, nor hearing<WH7182>. Wherefore he returned<WH7725> to meet<WH7125> him<WH5046>, and told him<WH559>, saying, The child<WH5288> is not awaked<WH6974>.
And when Elisha<WH477> was come<WH935> into the house<WH1004>, behold<WH5288>, the child was dead<WH4191>, and laid<WH7901> upon his bed<WH4296>.
He went in<WH935> therefore<WH5462>, and shut the door<WH1817> upon them twain<WH8147>, and prayed<WH6419> unto Jehovah<WH3068>.

And he went up<WH5927>, and lay<WH7901> upon the child<WH3206>, and put<WH7760> his mouth<WH6310> upon his mouth<WH6310>, and his eyes<WH5869> upon his eyes<WH5869>, and his hands<WH3709> upon his hands<WH3709>: and he stretched<WH1457> himself upon him<WH1320>; and the flesh of the child<WH3206> waxed warm<WH2552>.

Then he returned<WH7725>, and walked<WH3212> in the house<WH1004> once to<WH259> and fro<WH259>; and went up<WH5927>, and stretched<WH1457> himself upon him<WH5288>: and the child sneezed<WH2237> seven<WH7651> times<WH6471>, and the child<WH5288> opened<WH6491> his eyes<WH5869>.

And he called<WH7121> Gehazi<WH1522>, and said<WH559>, Call<WH7121> this Shunammite<WH7767>. So he called<WH7121> her<WH935>. And when she was come in unto him<WH559>, he said, Take up<WH5375> thy son<WH1121>.
Then she went in<WH935>, and fell<WH5307> at his feet<WH7272>, and bowed<WH7812> herself to the ground<WH776>; and she took up<WH5375> her son<WH1121>, and went out<WH3318>.

And Elisha<WH477> came again<WH7725> to Gilgal<WH1537>. And there was a dearth<WH7458> in the land<WH776>; and the sons<WH1121> of the prophets<WH5030> were sitting<WH3427> before<WH6440> him<WH559>; and he said unto his servant<WH5288>, Set<WH8239> on the great<WH1419> pot<WH5518>, and boil<WH1310> pottage<WH5138> for the sons<WH1121> of the prophets<WH5030>.

And one<WH259> went out<WH3318> into the field<WH7704> to gather<WH3950> herbs<WH219>, and found<WH4672> a wild<WH7704> vine<WH1612>, and gathered<WH3950> thereof wild<WH7704> gourds<WH6498> his lap<WH899> full<WH4393>, and came<WH935> and shred<WH6398> them into the pot<WH5518> of pottage<WH5138>; for they knew them not<WH3045>.

So they poured out<WH3332> for the men<WH582> to eat<WH398>. And it came to pass<WH398>, as they were eating of the pottage<WH5138>, that they cried out<WH6817>, and said<WH559>, O man<WH376> of God<WH430>, there is death<WH4194> in the pot<WH5518>. And they could<WH3201> not eat thereof<WH398>.

But he said<WH559>, Then bring<WH3947> meal<WH7058>. And he cast<WH7993> it into the pot<WH5518>; and he said<WH559>, Pour out<WH3332> for the people<WH5971>, that they may eat<WH398>. And there was no harm<WH1697> in the pot<WH5518>.

And there came<WH935> a man<WH376> from Baal-shalishah<WH1190>, and brought<WH935> the man<WH376> of God<WH430> bread<WH3899> of the first-fruits<WH1061>, twenty<WH6242> loaves<WH3899> of barley<WH8184>, and fresh ears of grain<WH3759> in his sack<WH6861>. And he said<WH559>, Give<WH5414> unto the people<WH5971>, that they may eat<WH398>.

And his servant<WH8334> said<WH559>, What<WH5414>, should I set this before<WH6440> a hundred<WH3967> men<WH376>? But he said<WH559>, Give<WH5414> the people<WH5971>, that they may eat<WH398>; for thus saith<WH559> Jehovah<WH3068>, They shall eat<WH398>, and shall leave thereof<WH3498>.
So he set<WH5414> it before<WH6440> them<WH398>, and they did eat, and left<WH3498> thereof<WH1697>, according to the word of Jehovah<WH3068>.
